page.title: 06Farming in Crosby on Eden.
page.content: Whitrigg Farm is typical of farms in the area. It is owned by Mr. J. Hardy. He bought the farm from his father in 1942 and built a bungalow for himself by the farm. He has lived in the farm all his life and there have been seven generations of Hardys at Whitrigg Farm. There are 52 dairy cows and the fields are mainly grassland for grazing. There are 15 acres of barley and 12 acres of hay out of 120 acres in all. In winter Mr. Hardy keeps 60 hogs to graze on the grass. There are also 15 calving heifers, 20 eighteen week old calves and 24 which are a year and a half old. He rears all the cattle himself. The farm also has 20 hens 3 geese and 6 goslings as well as 4 tractors, 2 ploughs and a silage pit.
